report:
Happy Friday, Beast fans! 

Today started off with great visibility and ended up a blizzard, with plenty more snow falling as of this writing. We’re looking at another potential 4-8" overnight plus another 1-2" tomorrow morning, on top of the 3” that fell before lifts stopped spinning today. All signs are pointing towards a day for the ages tomorrow. 

If you want to be the first to the powder in the morning, we have great news for you: the Bear Mountain Quad is scheduled to start spinning at 7:30 a.m. tomorrow. The rest of our key lifts are due to spin starting at 8:00 a.m., with the exception of Canyon Quad, South Ridge Quad, and the Snowdon Triple starting at 9:00 a.m. and the Snowshed Double starting at 10:00 a.m. 

Tomorrow’s weather looks like we’re in for another comfy day, with base temps hovering in the mid 20s all day. Winds will be very gentle at the bottoms of lifts and won’t gust higher than around 25mph at the peak. Seems like the bulk of the snow from this storm will fall before the morning, but please be cautious when commuting up to the mountain tomorrow. Our parking attendants will be out in force to make sure we can use our lots as efficiently as possible.

As for the snow conditions, not much more to say besides that we’re in for a heck of a powder day. Before the snow came down today, groomed runs were running ultra smooth, with a couple highlights being Lower Pipe Dream and Lower Wildfire. Tomorrow, truly everything will be in play, as we’re still boasting 100% of our open terrain. Powder day classics like Helter Skelter will get plenty of love tomorrow, while glade runs like Twister and Roundabout Glade are sure to be a blast. 

On the grooming front, our crew will be tackling an audacious 89 trails this evening, with many of the usuals making the cut plus a few additions. Solitude and Sassafras will get a grooming pass, so making first tracks on those winding trails will be a bit easier. All of Low Road will be smoothed out, giving an extra groomed option into Snowshed from Skye Peak. Frolic, Home Stretch, Pipe Dream, and many more will also be nice and smooth in the morning—check our Lifts & Trails Report for the whole list.

As if this storm wasn’t bringing enough snow, we’re back to making our own. That’s right: we’ll be turning the snowguns on tomorrow afternoon on Superstar, Skyelark, Bittersweet, High Road, and additional connecting trails around the mountain. This snowmaking run should last all the way through Wednesday, bringing even more cover to trails we hope to see skiing well into the spring. 

Shout out to our kparks team, a few of whom are up in Burlington tonight to build & maintain the course for this year’s Burton Winter Jam. In the meantime, the lineup in our own Killington Parks stays stacked. Over towards Bear Mountain, Dream Maker is firing with 21 features between the upper and lower sections, including a sweet rail section near the base of Bear Mountain, while The Stash remains fully in play with its wooden and stone features plus additional natural hits in the woods. On Ramshead, Timberline continues to shine with 45 features, 5 jumps, and a halfpipe, and Easy Street, Lil’ Stash, and Vale Yard are all dialed in for fun progression options. 

Rest your legs for tomorrow and enjoy the pow!

- Cullen

Groomed trails provide confidence inducing turns and are a blast to lean the edges into. Even as the day goes on, the smooth runs that turn into soft packed and packed powder continue to have a fun surface to rip on. 

Our groomers went after the same program except they left Ovation on natural. Downdraft saw a resurface again and Superstar is still skiing & riding really well.
